I'm [AGENT NAME]. Take a moment to introduce yourself.

Click on the Sharing Space to the left to examine a photo which shows a “1 FEET DEEP” sign on the side of a children’s pool. Discuss the following questions:|Why do some of the letters in “FEET DEEP” look different even though they are all painted the same size?|Why do you see multiple letters, even though each word is painted once?
Use ray diagrams to account for all the effects in this image. Paste URL(s) for your images into the Sharing Space for discussion.

Transparent prism foil is part of a backlight system in LCD monitors that are widely used today. The upper figure on the left shows a magnified cross section of such a foil (the foil is about 0.15 mm thick). The foil consists of prismatic ridges with angles at their peaks. The index of refraction of the foil is 1.58. This foil has very interesting optical properties. When you shine a light beam perpendicular to one side of the foil, the beam splits in two symmetrical beams (see photo (a)). Do you see the two symmetrical beams?
When you turn the foil around and repeat the experiment, the light beam reflects from the foil and no light passes through (see figure (b)).
Your task is to determine which side of the foil (the flat or prism side) was facing the flashlight in experiment (a) and which in experiment (b). Use ray diagrams to justify your answer.
How will the performance of the foil change if you cover the prism side of the foil with a layer of water (thick enough to fill and flatten the grooves)?
The activity is complete now. Please paste URL(s) for your results into the Sharing Space and remember to complete the peer marking assignment by ….|Have a great day!
